Hi all, I am a long time Marketer and RevOps specialist turned Full Stack Developer (4 months of experience). I am looking to learn more about the React-based cards in HubSpot:
• share leads and opportunities for projects in this sphere
• join existing or future projects in this sphere as an intern or junior full stack developer
I'm quite excited about the prospect of combining my long term relationship with HubSpot and my new career. Get in touch if any of this makes sense :slightly_smiling_face: (in the meantime I will be lurking around)
That would be pretty sick

of course, will do

For anyone else seeing this, removing the secret was the fix because the `PRIVATE_APP_ACCESS_TOKEN` can’t be a secret. HubSpot provides that to the workers, so declaring it a secret you want to provide is a conflict / error.

One thing I’m checking on our side though is the error should have been clear to remove that value from secrets, and from the screenshot, it doesn’t appear so clear.

Edit: the error trying to reproduce on my end now looks like this:
```The secret PRIVATE_APP_ACCESS_TOKEN referenced in the config file serverless.json is a reserved keyword and cannot be used. Create a secret under a different name by running `hs secrets add` or remove it from your `serverless.json` file. ```
This may be a recent adjustment, but if you aren’t seeing this warning in the future, do call it out.

Hi guys,

Pls any idea how to unset the radioButtonList once selected?
setting the value to null should do it
You'll also want to make sure that you don't have one of the options as `initialIsChecked`
Otherwise when you set the value to null it will default to the initialIsChecked one

Null means something hence why i’m seeing a bug and wondering how to reset without throwing a re-render

`initialIsChecked` isnt being used
I wont have this problem with checkboxList since you can unselect but I really want to use the radioBox instead
interesting
let me run a quick test
I suppose I could do something with initialIsChecked actually
oh nice!
good thinking

Hi  HS community!

I’ve recently conducted a usability review for a project and it brought up several new questions about the capabilities and limitations within custom UI cards in HubSpot.

Your expertise and experiences in this area would be greatly appreciated.

Here are the key questions we’re exploring.

Concerning UI card tables:
1. *Popup Details on Double Clicking a Row in a Custom UI Card Table*: Is it possible to have a popup display detailed information when double-clicking a row in a custom UI card table? Additionally, can this information in the popup be editable?
2. *Detail Information in a Separate UI Card*: Can information be shown in a different UI card below a custom UI card table, reflecting detailed information based on the row selected in the table?
3. *Filtering in Custom UI Card Tables*: Is filtering an option within these tables? For example, could a column with statuses be set to display only items marked as ‘new’?
Other UI Card Related Questions:
1. *Tabs within a UI Card*: Is it feasible to create tabs within a UI card for enhanced organization or navigation?
2. *Expand Screen Functionality for Tables in UI Cards*: Can we implement a feature to expand a table to full screen within HubSpot as a popup?
Popups in HS CRM:
1. *Capabilities of Popups*: Are the functionalities mentioned above achievable within popups in HS CRM? Do popups offer more flexibility or different capabilities?
I’d be grateful for your insights, suggestions, or examples from your experiences as we continue refining our project.

Looking forward to engaging with your thoughts!

It doesn’t look like you solved this.
Do you remember which endpoint you were trying to hit?

You’re correct in that those permissions aren’t directly available through private apps.
You need to request access to the `business-intelligence` scope group in your app.json configuration to hit the endpoint.

If you could point me to the endpoint, I’d want to look into why the error message wasn’t clearer.

So a couple of quick points and then I'll go one by one for you.
First popups are just iframes of webpages, these webpages can be HubSpot hosted or just any page. They aren't React Extensions. Iframes and Cards doesn't share state (besides things like query parameters).

While talking about state it's important to mention that cards (even if they're in the same project) doesn't share state between them, the permanent state for most cards are HubSpot property or external databases. You can't change something on one card and see the effect immediately on a different card (reload required).

Now one by one:

1. you definitely can trigger an iframe on select of a row (wrap the row in a link component, it would just be one click through), and use the onClick event to trigger the iframe, I would pass the row id to the iframe as a query parameter.
2. This is really tricky and so the short answer is no, I would suggest just keeping it all in the same card and using some dividers.
3. Yeah you can definitely build out filters and searches, but you build them custom, it's not as plug and play as an CrmAssociationTable
4. You definitely can do tabs with CRM cards, but the UI to indicate that you're on a new tab is sometimes a little tricky. I personally like to use the step indicator component, or button rows.
5. Unfortunately no you can't make a table component full screen.
6. Yeah like I explained above the iframes (popups) are entirely separate websites so you can build them out however you want.
<@U05FPHAQVAQ> we have a Panel component that is current in alpha that would help with #1 and #2. Here's an example :point_down: . We've also been thinking about modals as well.
Can I get in the Alpha <@U04EJHVD8FM>?
<@U05KNCMAE7N> :eyes:
Hi Filip, the best place to start would be the CRM customization home page (bookmarked on the channel) that collects all information in one place.
